newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian stocks end lower, golds lose shine.
newsitem.headline: Australian stocks end lower, golds lose shine.

text.p: Australian shares closed weaker on Friday as market leader BHP retraced some of its recent gains and gold miners followed the bullion price lower.

National Australia Bank was the star performer with its shares cracking a record high of A$14.42 (US$11.67) as buyers voiced their approval of Thursday's 6.8 percent rise in annual net profit to A$2.1 billion.
By the close, the All Ordinaries index shed 9.1 points to 2,383.4.
"BHP came off again in the afternoon and the golds were hit after the price drop but the rest just muddled along," said a Sydney broker.
"National Australia Bank had a good result Thursday and that helped the banks along."
Mining house CRA followed its dual listed twin RTZ Corp Plc into firmer territory, gaining five cents to A$20.05 in an overall weaker resources sector.
Falls outnumbered rises by a ratio of about seven to five, while about 30 percent of stocks traded remained steady.
